sen.j: 煮豆（にまめ）は、ダイズやアズキ、の乾燥豆を水でもどし、甘い味付けでやわらかく煮たものである。
sen.e: Boiled beans are dried beans such as soybeans, azuki beans and peas which are rehydrated and boiled with sugar until beans are tender.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nimame (boiled beans) is a type of dish that is prepared by rehydrating soybeans, azuki, or other dried beans and then boiling them with sugar until they are tender.
Nimame (boiled beans) is a type of dish that is prepared by rehydrating soybeans, azuki, or other dried beans and then boiling them with sugar until they are tender.
They are one of the Japanese boiled foods.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They are one of the Japanese boiled foods.
They are one of the Japanese boiled foods.

sen.j: 乾燥した豆を事前に十分に水に漬けてもどし、弱火でゆっくり煮る。
sen.e: After being fully rehydrated, dried beans are simmered over low heat.
After being fully rehydrated, dried beans are simmered gently over low heat.
After being fully rehydrated, dried beans are simmered gently over low heat.

sen.j: 途中で砂糖などの調味料を加えて、味を豆の芯まで含ませる。
sen.e: And by the addition of sugar and seasonings to beans in this process, their flavor penetrates the beans deeply to the core.
And by the addition of sugar and seasonings to beans in this process, their flavor penetrates the beans deeply to the core.
And by the addition of sugar and seasonings to beans in this process, their flavor penetrates the beans deeply to the core.

sen.j: 豆の種類や調味料などの違いで、うぐいす豆、富貴豆、ぶどう豆、五目豆など、様々な種類がある。
sen.e: Boiled beans vary depending on the type of beans, seasonings, etc: For example, uguisu beans, Fuki beans (boiled broad beans), Budo beans (boiled soybeans with sweet taste) and Gomoku beans (soybeans boiled with carrot, burdock, lotus root and konnyaku).

Boiled beans vary depending on the type of beans, seasonings, etc and examples of these beans include uguisu beans, Fuki beans (boiled broad beans), Budo beans (boiled soybeans with sweet taste) and Gomoku beans (soybeans boiled with carrot, burdock, lotus root and konnyaku).

Boiled beans vary depending on the type of beans, seasonings, etc and examples of these beans include uguisu beans, Fuki beans (boiled broad beans), Budo beans (boiled soybeans with sweet taste) and Gomoku beans (soybeans boiled with carrot, burdock, lotus root and konnyaku).
